FOREWORD
This Faculty Manual is designed to provide faculty members of the University
regardless of employment status pertinent information about their rights and
privileges, duties and responsibilities, their code of behavior, including matters on
leave and retirement. It also indicates the relationship of the faculty and the state,
community, profession, associates, administrators, students, parents and private
business.
It is the hope of the University that every member of the faculty is given the
feeling that he is important, that he is secured and protected. This is because the
teacher is a very essential aspect of every institution of learning. The teacher is a
significant factor that spells the quality of graduates the University produces.
This manual had considered the Faculty Manual of other SUCS, existing
laws, and certain provision of the University Code.
It is therefore a must for every faculty to read this Manual.
